description: Urban Capers Scavenger Hunts offer up history, culture and local folklore while teams compete to find answers to tricky and humorous questions. Whether you're in the mood for mystery, history, or spooky after-dark adventures, try an Urban Capers Scavenger Hunt!

reviews.title: AGO Adventure
text: We were looking for an afternoon activity to do with our friends and our adult children aged 24 - 30.  This was a great choice. There were 12 of us, but it would also be fun for couples or smaller/larger groups.  The event was very well organized and we found the clues to be just enough of a challenge to keep it interesting.  If you are an AGO member, call when purchasing your tickets because the price includes admission to the AGO.  There is a prize for the winning team which is pretty cool.  After the adventure is over, you can stay at the AGO if there were areas you still wanted to see.  Overall, a fabulous afternoon of fun!

reviews.title: ROM Mystery Murder Scavenger Hunt
text: Well organized. Good utilization of museum's artifacts blending in with mystery murder clues. Had a great time!

reviews.title: Intrigue at the AGO was intriguing
text: Participated in the scavenger hunt at the Art Gallery of Ontario with my girlfriend. It was a lot of fun and took up the majority of the 2 and half hours which was good. We wish the clues had been harder to solve. The majority of people who participated successfully completed the entire scavenger hunt. Make sure if you have a membership pass to the AGO you call before buying tickets for this activity because general admission to the gallery is included in the price. Overall great time and well organized.

reviews.title: Amazing time
text: This is the second time we've done one of their events for our Company, the first was at th ROM , but I have to say the second one we just did at the Distillery District was by far the best one, it's so fun, you can enjoy the district and afterwards enjoy a beer and pretezls at the pub, we made a dinner out of the event. The hosts are amazing and so funny and make sure you enjoy the event.
You can go as a coporate event or small group.

reviews.title: Fabulous day in Kensington Market
text: Fantastic morning spent in and around Kensington Market and Chinatown. Super great organizers made sure that the 38 of us had so much fun discovering the many nooks and crannies in this unique area of Toronto. Great art, food, and interesting stories. Highly recommend this outing.

reviews.title: Team building success
text: We did the Murder at the ROM. What a fabulous time. Everything was well organized. I had a group of 27 people from all across Canada and the US. It was great. Not a single negative comment. I would recommend this to anyone and I’ll probably do it again with my friends.

reviews.title: Team Building Scavenger Hunt in Distillery District
text: This wasn't what I expected.  It was much harder than I thought and after 2 hours, I felt frustrated.  The map btw 1923 and today don't match.  I also found some of the clues didn't make sense.  Apparently we missed some buildings.  Perhaps some further explanation would have been helpful.  We also never got to read thru the pamphlet we were given.  The team is very nice and friendly.  The Distillery district is very pretty and I would return just to visit, but not sure I would do another hunt.

reviews.title: Secret of St Lawrence Market
text: Creative scavenger hunt encourages you to seek out what's hidden to most and really discover the city! A group of friends went to celebrate a birthday and we had an absolute blast! Very clever and highly encouraged to try this out, we'll be back for more hunts!

reviews.title: The Great Whiskey Heist
text: I had the very great pleasure of taking in this tour this past weekend for my birthday.  I booked a large party and initially, I failed to see the time of the tour until after I booked 12 tickets.  Well, when I realized my error and 6 guests could no longer come, they were quick to refund me for the people who couldn't come.  It was quick, they were kind and that experience alone had me looking forward to the actual event.

It was well planned, well executed and very professional.  Prizes were handed out to the winning team and the team with the best name and afterwards we all got to enjoy drinks and an appy at a nearby bar.  I had 2 guests who dressed up in the era.  They were awesome.  My only suggestion is to include a little something for those who dress the part (literally).  HA!!

We loved being able to actually go inside the buildings and learn a little about the history of the distillery.  Yes, the buildings are old and make a beautiful picture (we saw a couple getting their engagement photos done and 2 weddings).  Yes, it's a touristy spot with some pretty amazing sculptures (the 3 legged spider, the heart and the LOVE sign) and restaurants (Soma, El Catrin, Brick Street Bakery) but there is a story to tell.  I've been to the distillery a number of times and never knew I could venture inside and learn about it all.  This tour allowed me to do that.

The organizer (Jodi I think) was lovely.  She filled us in that the company has really taken off in the last year and they hope to have more events like it in the future.  They are currently putting the finishing touches on the Curse of the Mummy caper which we can't wait to try.  All of my guests complimented me on my choice of activity and most of them agreed, they would be back for another tour.

Responses to other reviews:  this is a new and developing company.  So, they may not have the money available to throw around on prizes.  If you're unhappy with the quality of prize, politely decline it.  I'm sure in the near future, they may no longer ask for their materials back to use on another group.  And even if they do, they are being environmental conscious.  What would you honestly do with the reading materials if you took them home?  Toss them away, right?!
Well done, Urban Capers.  We'll see you again soon!!  And thank you for the bottle of Gooderham and Worts.  :D

reviews.title: Murder at the ROM
text: I have been to the ROM several times with my family and on class trips and this was by far the most fun.  Highly recommend this event for families with kids 12 and older and groups.  Team building perhaps?  Sure beats roaming around without purpose.  I experienced different parts of the museum that I hadn't seen during my other visits.  Also, admission to the museum is included so following the event take some time to have a late lunch across the street at The Museum Tavern then go back and explore the ROM some more.  Great event for a cold or rainy day!

reviews.title: A Very Fun Day!
text: Thanks Urban Capers for a fun day out at the ROM! For those looking for a new way to explore the ROM, these capers are for you. But as the entire murder mystery must be solved in in two hours, it's not a great way to experience the ROM for the first time. The scavenger hunt was clever, and we look forward to trying out some other urban capers once the warmer weather hits!

reviews.title: Fun game - will do another
text: ROM Murder Mystery

Well, this is a lousy way to see the ROM, but a fun scavenger hunt. I'd recommend that you allow yourself the whole day. You'll complete the game in 2-3 hours. Once that's done, your ROM admission ticket (included with Urban Capers) allows you to remain. Maybe the game will steer you towards parts you'd like to explore more. You do see much of the ROM during the game, albeit with a tight focus that misses most of what's going on around you.
We (parents and two young adult offspring) had fun and would definitely try another of their games.

reviews.title: Best birthday adventure
text: We had a team of two adults and four 13 year old boys on the Haunted Toronto caper this past weekend.  It was spooky, but so much fun!  We all learned so much that we had never known about our own city.  Jodi is super flexible and fun, which made it an easy and perfect birthday activity.

reviews.title: Urban Capers is a Must Do!
text: My husband, 13 year old niece and I attended Urban Caper's "Murder at the ROM" on August 17.  It was an amazing afternoon!  Very well organized, clever mystery in a fantastic atmosphere, wonderful staff and all around good time.  We look forward to future Urban Capers adventures and strongly encourage people to try it out.  Visit their site and choose from their many adventures.  Well done, Urban Capers, see you soon for another adventure.

reviews.title: Great way to see the ROM!
text: My partner and I, both in our mid twenties, loved our Urban Capers murder-mystery scavenger hunt! It was a fun way to see the museum (since we had seen it many times before- but never like this!). The 2 hours was the perfect amount of time, and we loved that each team was staggered so we didn't run into many teams along the way. After the hunt, we were able to go back through parts of the museum that we wanted to take our time and enjoy more thoroughly which was a nice added bonus post hunt! We ABSOLUTELY recommend Urban Capers' hunts!
Looking forward to trying out the Kensington Market hunt and Haunted Toronto!

reviews.title: Urban Capers Kensington
text: I had a great time with my wife . It was interesting and I was able to explore the market and try some great food. The host's of the scavenger hunt were great at getting us started. The food recommendations helped me pick out some awesome snacks and now I plan to head back another day and walk around some more . I have also done the ROM caper as well and had fun there as well. Looking forward to more hunts in the future. We really enjoy these outings.

reviews.title: Murder At The ROM
text: I understand it's nearly impossible to shut down a museum for an event like this but I certainly wish it could have been.  The idea was fun. The staff was great.  The venue is superb.  The only issue I had was that a team of two is not enough.  My wife and I didn't complete the task.  I understand that we may not be the smartest people on the planet but we moved through each clue easily with very little difficulty and we still ram out of time.  I guess that's not a real issue but perhaps adding something to the description stating that a team of two may have trouble negotiating the museum within the time limit.
Other than that,  I'd do it again.  It was a cool day at the museum. Dear parents,  kids under the age of 10 have no business at the ROM. Especially when the weather is beautiful.

reviews.title: They were very disorganized
text: I was excited to be exploring Kensington through food and a fun scavenger hunt but as soon as I read the first clue I was confused. The clues were vague and provided no location info. Then 2 hours into the 3 hour hunt the leader stumbled upon us to tell us that they gave us the hard guide book for their expert tours so I was quite annoyed spending all my time running around. At ;east they offered us a diferent tour free. Would have been good if they had paid attention to what they were doing. However I would save my money and just walk the streets and save your money for food. NO FOOD INCLUDED.

reviews.title: Fantastic day Foraging through Kensington
text: My friends and I had a wonderful time on this adventure.  It was so much fun!!! A great way to explore this unique area of Toronto. A historical scavenger hunt and some fantastic food along the way. Well planned and well run. We can't wait to try another Urban Capers.

reviews.title: Kensington Culinary Adventure
text: Excellent day enough challenge to keep interest up enough fun and food for retelling. Very well organized with a great map and a book full of interesting clues to cool finds. Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Over priced!
text: We did Murder at the ROM last Sunday. It was a fun experience and the staff was great. At the end of the scavenger hunt, one group "won" and got free tickets to another Urban capers scavenger hunt. I wouldn't do it again only because it is too expensive for what it is. They tell you that you cannot get refunds or exchanges because their people get to work as soon as they get a reservation. For that reason, we expected a bit more effort put into the actual hunt but we were quite disappointed.

reviews.title: Highly recommend - Toronto scavenger hunts
text: I've discovered more of Toronto doing scavenger hunts with Urban Capers than I have having lived in the city my whole life. I've done almost most all of their capers, each one was amazing, and the staff are always really friendly. Its a great way to spend an afternoon with friends, or for a date. I would recommend this to anyone visiting the city as well.

reviews.title: It's over rated
text: I did the St . Lawrence market tour. It was well researched but questions were sometimes vague or misleading *ship question. The event is also expensive for what you get and you don't even get to keep your tour booklet. Plus if you aren't 100% with the people in your group you're SOL. Think about another activity first.

reviews.title: Murder at the ROM - So much fun!
text: Having already visited (and thoroughly enjoyed) the ROM on a previous trip to Toronto, we thought this would be a fun activity to do. We were a mixed group (myself, my mother, my two teenage kids, my sister and her friend), and everyone had a great time. The variety in the types and difficulty levels of the clues meant everyone played a part in solving the murder mystery. We called ourselves "The Mixed Nuts" (you need to have a team name) and we actually won! One note: If you want to spend time seeing the excellent museum exhibits, you should probably do so on a separate visit. When we were done with the murder mystery, we were exhausted, and although we had two more hours afterwards to explore, we were too tired to see very much.

reviews.title: Haunted Toronto - fun exploration!
text: Four friends and I did the Haunted Toronto Caper (we are all in our late 30s), and we had a great time following the clues, looking for answers, and reading some fun stories about the beautiful buildings and monuments on the hunt. I think this would be a fun activity for families, couples, and groups of friends looking to combine history, mystery, and fun.

reviews.title: History Nerd Date
text: An amazing way to spend the day and very unique way to explore the museum. Searching for clues within the information makes you take a closer look at everything at the ROM and want to come back after the scavenger hunt. I will be returning for the new one - mummy's curse.

reviews.title: Murder at the ROM - lots of fun
text: What a great way to visit the ROM!  Booked the murder at the ROM online on impulse and i'm so glad i did, the sold out event was so much fun! The reps from urban capers were really enthusiastic and good fun.  We were given 2 hours to wander the museum and try and solve the murder.  Although we didn't win in was a great time and excellently organised, highly recommended

reviews.title: Perfect way to revisit the ROM
text: In anticipation of friends visiting, we pre-booked tickets for the Urban Capers " Murder at the ROM" event. BOOK WELL IN ADVANCE FOR THIS WEEKEND EVENT. Meeting at the ROM entrance the organizers had everything ready & explained the event to our group. Total of 50 people involved in various sized groups. You can be in your own group. Groups were started at different locations within the ROM ( Royal Ontario Museum) so crowding around clues was avoided. Purpose of event is to discover clues on who murdered the museum curator. For those who enjoy murder mysteries and solving puzzles, this is it. Make sure you get there 15 minutes prior to start time so you can review the package. You can solve within time slot but, no time to spare. Winner gets free passes to another Urban Capers event. 2.5 hour event & your ticket allows you to explore ROM AFTER EVENT.

reviews.title: Lots of fun! Mystery solved!
text: Great times solving the murder mystery.  You have two hours to solve - we managed with about 20 minutes to spare and spent the rest of the time reasoning out the motive (which was also fun). Having been to the ROM many times, this was a refreshing way to visit the place. Staff were friendly and helpful. We obviously won because we are so awesome hahaha. Definitely going to try another adventure this summer!

reviews.title: Fun and Challenging Way to Go Through the ROM
text: We went with another couple last weekend.  This is perfect if you would like to see the ROM but don't have the interest to linger long at the exhibits. We had a ton of fun figuring out the clues, checking out the hints and uncovering the answers. We figured out who and where, but not why and how.  Really a unique way to check out history.

reviews.title: Murder at the ROM
text: This was so much fun and a great way to see the ROM. The story line is well laid out and the clues lead you in a well laid out pattern of the ROM. Two hours was cutting it close to finish but that's part of the fun!

reviews.title: Lazy and disappointing
text: Went with high expectations to the "Whiskey Heist", the day was perfect and we had a decent group. For 40 bucks a person one would expect some effort, but the whole thing consists of a small notebook (8 pages tops) that you "HAVE TO RETURN OR LOSE POINTS FOR THE GREAT PRIZE" that pretty much makes you walk around the Distillery District. I thought "heck, they probably have some actors or some props going on", but no, its basically based on things you have already seen if you have ever stepped on the district. No effort whatsoever from the 2 girls running the "show", and when we were done (its 2 hours, took 1:15 to complete) we ran into them and they gave us a heavy eye roll and told us to wait till it was the final time as they proceeded to walk into a bar.

At the end of the laziest hunt I've ever had they proceeded to grade our answers like a test and give the magnificent prize of a dollar store magnifying glass (only 1 even though groups were from 2 to 6).

If I could ask for my money back it would be the most excitement this scavenger hunt would bring me. Don't waste your time, take a walk on the distillery district by yourself and spend those 40 on some awesome lunch and some drinks. Or not, but don't waste them on this.

reviews.title: Murder At The Rom
text: I came across this place while I was browsing the Internet and didn't know what to expect but I thought why not give it a shot. I registered online for myself and my girlfriend which was very simple to do. They send you a confirmation email when you are finished and you bring it with you to the event. One of the things we were worried about is that we may have to interact with lots of random people in order to solve the murder but it really is just you and your team working through clues using the museum to find the answers. We started off not really engaged in the game not knowing what to expect but once it started we were having an amazing time trying to find answers to clues. I really recommend this for couples it's a great way to spend 2-3 hours of your day getting some exercise, working together and having some fun while doing it!

reviews.title: Family Fun!!!
text: If you want to have a great time in Toronto, then this is a must do!! My boyfriend and I were on holidays visiting Family and I came across this Haunted Toronto Scavenger Hunt and asked if they wanted to go. My brother was not overly excited about it at first, but lets just say he got into the mood when it began. We loved it. The guides were great and did a good job orginizing the scavenger hunt. I can't wait to go back and try the other ones that they have available. They sell out quick. We almost missed the oppertunity to go!

reviews.title: Fun way to see the ROM
text: My sister and I did Murder at the ROM and loved it. if you have never been to the ROM this is a quick way to view the exhibits and learn a little history at the same time. It is fast paced and you breeze through some exhibits, but if you do an early game you have more time after the game to see anything you may have missed during the game.

reviews.title: ROM Murder Mystery was amazing
text: Our group of friends tried out the Murder Mystery at the ROM to celebrate a friend's birthday recently and we had so much fun. The experience exceeded our expectations and it was a great way to enjoy the ROM. The creators have done a great job connecting the ROM's history and exhibits to the Murder Mystery clues and story. Plus you get an awesome gold magnifying glass if you win (which we did)!

reviews.title: Whisky Heist Mystery
text: Great experience.. Would never have known that the distillery is a living museum and that there were so many artifacts in the buildings.  Great way to learn about the distillery and a lot of fun to learn some history about the city.

reviews.title: ROM is the Bomb!
text: Went to ROM urban Capers event at the ROM and had fun trying to solve the murder mystery. Organizers were funny and engaging in preparing for the event as well as the recap. A great time to spend a few hours with fri nods and become awed at the cool artifacts at the ROM (your tix includes admission too!).   Will definitely like to try their other adventures.

reviews.title: Fun way to see the ROM
text: This is a really fun way to see the ROM.  Questions are well researched and the hosts are enthusiastic. Great way to spend a Sunday.

reviews.title: Would Recommend!
text: Did the Murder at the ROM and although I have been to this museum multiple times, I explored different parts and learned new things!  Questions were well-researched and we had an AMAZING time working out the various parts of the mystery.  Our team was 4 adults in our mid-20s and it was one of the best interactive activities we've done!  It was just intellectually stimulating enough and so much fun!
The staff were also wonderful to work with.
Would highly recommend for others and I know our group will be back to do many more Urban Capers events!
